part.narration: NoLifeQueen — Yuki — NoLifeQueen comes to. She looks around. All else is pitch black.NoLifeQueen looks at the camera.
part.line: Yuki, I knew I would end up in your dreams.
Is it because I'm prettier than you?
part.narration: NoLifeQueen flexes her little arm through the sleeveless dress.
part.line: Is it because I'm stronger than you?
Is it because I'm more real than you?
What is a dream but One More Game?
part.narration: Zoom out.Galaxies materialize and fly past NoLifeQueen. One blinds her. When it is long gone, she looks up.
A skeleton strapped to a rocket. His karategi catches the celestial flame. His old bones creak to an otherworldly shriek. He looks down on the little lady.
part.line: You have put forth no true effort to save Sega.

choice.comment: The Player decided to do a sequel in any Conceptualization stage so far.
choice.line: You have bastardized generations of Sega's work with your reimaginings.

choice.comment: The Player never made a sequel in any Conceptualization stage so far.
choice.line: You have made no effort to continue Sega's legacy.

choice.comment: The Player hired every candidate during any Expansion so far.
choice.line: You accepted every Tom, Dick, and Harry that came your way.

choice.comment: The Player did not hire every candidate during Expansion so far.
choice.line: Your selection process dashed your so-called equal opportunity employment effort.

choice.comment: The Player wrote too many documents for Planning and Elaboration.
choice.line: You spent too much time planning and had very little action.

choice.comment: The Player didn't write enough documents, leaving them to deprecate during Planning and Elaboration.
choice.line: Your development process was directionless and undisciplined.

choice.comment: The Player often dismissed Design attributes in any Tuning stage.
choice.line: You often disregarded the most important element of a game: its design.

choice.comment: The Player often dismissed non-Design attributes in any Tuning stage.
choice.line: You did not bring your game's elements into a coherent whole.

choice.comment: The Player decided not to reserve any employees during any Shipping stage so far.
choice.line: You fruitlessly overworked your employees when the job was done.

choice.comment: The Player reserved many employees during any Shipping stage so far.
choice.line: You didn't keep your employees up to speed when the job was done.

choice.comment: The Player often agreed with critics during the Review stage.
choice.line: You too often acknowledged the unsightly opinions of game journalists.

choice.comment: The Player often disagreed with critics during the Review stage.

part.line: You are a disgrace to Sega.
part.narration: The skeleton wails. The stars implode. The rocket sets its way to explode. The light of flame reveals, written on all of the rocket's sides, in all the world's tongues, a single phrase.
